topic: President Donald Trump delivered a "cryptic warning" to Chinese President Xi Jinping regarding the "consequences" of a potential invasion of Taiwan, a self-governing island that China claims as its te...

items.text: This is likely a strategic move to reinforce the credibility of US security guarantees to allies in the region.

If Trump convinces China to abandon force against Taiwan he ...

items.text: The warning is likely intended to deter China by making the cost of invasion unacceptably high and unpredictable.
The wording suggests a deliberate attempt to keep China guessing about the nature and scope of potential US responses.

relevant_links.title:
Trump says Xi understands 'consequences' if China invades Taiwan
www.news.com.au › World › North-ame
relevant_links.extracted_content: Deals of the Week 7:25am Monday, November 3rd, 2025 In the know quiz Sydney 18 °/ 28 ° Sign Up Log In World North America Us Politics Trump says Xi understands ‘consequences’ if China invades Taiwan US President Donald Trump has made several big claims in a new TV interview set to air in the US. AFP less than 2 min read November 3, 2025 - 4:33AM Listen to this article 1 min South Korea's Lee asks China's Xi for help engaging the North South Korean President Lee Jae Myung sought Chinese President Xi Jinping's help in efforts to resume... more US President Donald Trump said Xi Jinping understands the consequences if China invades Taiwan, while refusing to specifically say the US would defend the island, according to an extract of a CBS News interview broadcast Sunday. Mr Trump said Taiwan “never even came up as a subject” when he met the Chinese president in South Korea on Thursday for their first face-to-face meeting in six years. Asked on CBS’s “60 Minutes” whether he would order US forces into action if China moved militarily on Taiwan, Mr Trump said: “You’ll find out if it happens, and he understands the answer to that.” But Mr Trump declined to spell out what he meant in the interview conducted Friday at his Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida, adding: “I can’t give away my secrets. The other side knows.” The US president claimed that Mr Jinping and those close to him had “openly said” that “’we would never do anything while President Trump is president,’ because they know the consequences.” China claims self-governing Taiwan as its territory. Under longstanding policy, the US recognises only Beijing but provides weapons for the island’s self-defence. The issue continues to provoke tensions, which Mr Trump and Mr Jinping appeared to have avoided at their summit, focusing instead on easing the trade war between Washington and Beijing.
